caption: The view and the location is amazing, but the food really needs improvement.
Nice atmosphere and view. Combined with a walk in the park make a nice day. With or without museums.
Well, I know why people love Miami. It's because the food here wherever you is amazing. Verde is another example of good execution, very fresh ingredients and top 🔝 service.
Nice place for lunch. Good food, good cocktails. Great view with great breeze.
Food is okay. Great views, and open area.

Brunch here is amazing. A perfect plan would be to visit the Perez Art museum or the Frost science museum and then stop here for lunch while enjoying a perfect view of the bay. Menu includes a lot of healthy yet delicious options. Unfortunately, parking can be expensive here; just be aware.

All dining currently is patio dining due to covid-19.  I started off my meal with a really nicely spiced bloody Mary which had just the right amount of zestiness. It wasn't too spicy, but just enough to wake up my palate for dinner. It was …

Great brunch!! First time here and my family enjoyed it very much— the food was great (pancakes were phenomenal) and so was our waitress Mayte who was so sweet and attentive! Highly recommend for a great spot for brunch with a view.
Excellent food, good eervice and beautiful ambience.

Never a bad time at Covell. Tucked away in the midst of hipsterdom, Covell is the spot if you want a mellow, relaxed and intimate settings filled with dozens of different wine options. They stock and pour a variety of local and foreign …
Was told the new chef specialized in pastries. Had the blueberry pancakes, was not disappointed. Ambiance and view are special as well.

Fantastic location, the service and the food were both top notch. The Grilled Salmon and the Brunch Burger were out of this world. Both taste and texture were made to perfection. The servers were also amazing, I felt that I never had to …

After a long walk, we ended up at Verde for lunch. And they didn't disappoint! Wonderful outdoor seating and the tables were far away from each other. The menu was exemplary for the weekend brunch. We settled for the wonderful soup, …
This place simply knows how to please their clients. Consistently with a super friendly approach. The food is conveniently priced, always fresh and neat.
Very nice service and amazing food! Must visit!
Amazing experience. Our waitress (tall, beautiful half cuban half chilean) is very professional, funny, authentic and professional.

Agree with some of the previous commenters that even though they are corralled by a red-vest-wearing Pat, the staff seems a bit lackluster and because I wanted decaf wound up eating my breakfast without a 2nd cup of coffee.
Excellent spot for delicious american food. Food was so yummy. It has a cool atmosphere.
The food and service were beyond my expectations. I really enjoyed the environment of this place. Superb place to take my family out for dinner.
Great location for American food. Looking forward to coming back with my coworkers. Feels like a place in Charlotte that I enjoyed visiting.
One of my top places for american food. nothing but pleasant experiences here. the bill was fair i would say. feels similar to a cafe in chicago i liked.
American food and the scene at this location is super good. certainly worth a return trip.

A preferred place for quality american food. Great location to chill, eat some good food. The service was very welcoming and observant. It has a good interior. This place has many reviews for a reason.

They make their own gin which is a unique and delicious blend and I highly recommend. The staff was amazing.
One of the best in Miami! They offer very good cocktails. The bar is hidden like a lot of bars in Miami, so you might miss it if you don’t know it!
A little pricey but decent and a great view.
Good food but service level could be of better manners.

The food is surprisingly amazing! Everything that we ate was delicious, Maybe it Looks like a simple sandwich but the combination of flavors are very well balanced an with an exotic touch ... Simple Delicious. If you visit the Perez museum, please  Don't miss it!

This week, my hubby and I went to Verde for lunch.  It is located just across the street from our apartment and we frequently eat here.  I am surprised that this restaurant has such low reviews given how fresh and delicious everything is! …

OK. The falafel, while flavorful, was just warm, it should have been hot. The hummus was good, albeit, salty. Mushroom pizza was excellent. Hamburger was definitely not worth $17, lacked flavor, was juicy however.

Love to eat here by the water. Perfect spot after visiting the Perez Art or Frost Museum. Easy atmosphere, great service. We had the burrata with grilled peaches and pizza with prosciutto. Everything super tasty! Not on the cheap side but welll worth it!!!
Menu variety = okay, service and food is good, location + a view of bay = awesome!

Love this place, great food, good views, nice atmosphere. My only complaint would be the hours they keep and that they removed the Shakshuka from the menu - it was amazing.

If you have never come to Verde you are truly missing out. It has one of the most delicious brunch in the city  like the cinnamon swirl pancakes uber delish. From the bar you can't go wrong with the short rib empanadas or Corn ones and the Perez Salad is the combination of everything hearty  just delicious in one green plate.
Terrific food! Slow service.
Great food and service, had a good time.
Miami's best outdoor place. Safe for kids. Dogs welcome.
Always delicious!
Gorgeos!

One of the nicest restaurants I’ve ever been to. The views are amazing, and outdoor seating is so pleasant. The food was not only affordable but also really delicious. Presentation of each dish was spot on, and service was impeccable. We had a flawless experience here for Sunday brunch.

On the water in the PAMM and absolutely charming. The food was excellent and the view is magnificent. I never think of museum restaurants as their own entities but this one is special.

caption: This rating is for the short rib Mac and cheese,  alone which is a work of art in and of itself. Super rich, something to split, but I can’t imagine coming back to Miami and not having it at least once.

Expensive and extremely limited menu , it matches perfect with the mediocre perez art museum which is another ripoff

Very nice food, view of the sea, iguanas in artificial vertical gardens, squirrels stealing bits of food.
I recently went to an event here. They paired a five course meal with beers from Concrete Beach Brewery. Exceptional flavor and prompt service during the entire event. I will return
I've been in Miami for 10 years and this is hands down one of my favorite joints to eat!
Always a great place to view the best of Miami! Food is very nice.

One of my favorite places when I have to go to downtown Miami. The food is spectacular and generally always great service. Just check before going as they have some days they are closed during the week and also have fun events periodically.

I really love this place the food is excelent and the view amazing
Wow is all i have to say about the food here. It was so good, expensive, but good for sure.
Excellent food in an amazing place. Great views of the ocean

Their breakfast burger is amazing! I prefer ordering it with normal fries rather the breakfast fries

Unfriendly or no reaction from cashier and staff. Paid 7$ (SEVEN!) for an average-tasting and rather small-sized flat white. Were not even allowed to sit in the cafe area for a few minutes, because we had ordered a takeaway. This place is a joke.

A perfect fusion of Italian and American favorites with a heavy influence on homemade pastas, steaks and fresh seafood. With a full liquor bar and an extensive wine and cocktail menu primos is a favorite among locals for happy hour and late night dining.
Five stars! Great food, nice friendly environment . Food and service are amazing. Would definitely visit again.  I highly recommend this company . Great company.
It is good place for have a brunch. I just have a Margarita 🍕 was really good. Also the view is amazing!
Beautiful cafe, great location, nice view and delicious food
Loved it. Not a lot of raw options but good choice of vegan burgers, bowls, salads, etc. Burger tasted great, salad was wonderful as well. We enjoyed our experience there.

It's right by the waterfront behind the Frost Science Center, so great location and view. The vibe was chic and artsy, and the food was remarkably delicious with fresh produce; not greasy at all! Yum! Little pricey, but worth it for the quality of ingredients.
Martin our waiter did a great job. We loved the service. Verde is by far our favorite restaurant in town.
Great location, good food and service

Beautiful location on the bay and at the Perez art museum. Seating inside and outside. I recommend outside and I recommend going for brunch!! Bloody Mary there is my favourite in Miami. Brunch plates are delicious. Good service and simple plates but will definitely fill you.

Slow service.  Good french fries.  Getting pretty uninspired and tired after a few years of serving it seems precisely the same menu.  Waitresses try hard but kitchen a bit slow and food is moving to the OK side almost to mediocre but they …
Lovely restaurant at the Pérez museum. Has great food, great cocktails, great service. Also is in a very cool space that has a nice view the causeway and the water.
First time. Not a good experience.

Sunday afternoon at the Perez Art Museum... Verde is a good place for brunch along the way. Creative burgers, pizzas and salads. Featuring brunch fare like Bloody Mary’s and Shrimp and Grits. The French fries are a nice snack. The waterfront views are nice and you can choose indoor or outdoor seating.

We loved everything we ordered food-wise, the service was good, and the view was a nice touch to an overall great experience.  Recommendation: They offer a bread basket (which they charge you for) that comes with a variety of different …

Food is varied, good presentation, great quality, and a notable options' list. Besides good service and food the view makes it 5 star. It is best to go on a weekday mid afternoon to enjoy the tranquility and take the view all with minimal interference.

The food was great, host and server were polite, prompt, and friendly. View was awesome. Ate outside in the late afternoon probably as good as it gets. The coffee and juice bar was cool and I definitely recommend checking out the museum gift shop.
Come here all the time. Great food, great service, great view.

The view is beautiful! But the service was horrible. We had to keep asking the waiter to bring our drinks. I had to go through half of my meal without anything to drink. He also didn't write down our orders and got the order wrong for one of the people in our group. Avoid this place!!

Outstanding service, food is as well. Went for a busy Mother's Day and the service was continually good even though very busy. I don't recommend outdoor seating during the warmer months as there are no fans outside. Excellent time would visit again.

Sweet potato soup is not good. Salad and cheeseburger are ok, but nothing special. You could easily find better version somewhere. Chocolate tart and key lime pie are simply not good, I would not recommend this place to anybody.
Don't come. You'll be frustrated.  Hostess doesn't want to host,  waitress doesn't care about serving and so on. Lots of attitude,  no fun!
Location and food is fantastic

Beautiful view, great service, even better food. Not much to choose from but it's amazing. Very healthy options here, too.
Food's always been good. Service, so-so. The place is beautiful.

The quality of food and service is very good, especially taking into consideration that Verde is a part of the museum. The service was a bit slow, which is understandable since the restaurant was fully booked. I enjoyed my lunch here.

Awful food in a beautiful location. My suggestion? Too many good restaurants in the area. Eat someplace else before visiting the museum.... unless having a drink with a gorgeous view...... save yourself from a bad culinary experience. P. S : Really friendly and helpful staff.
Place is great. It seems the prices have gone up a lot.  Before 4 people was around $100. Yesterday 2 people $100.00.
Great view, location, and good food.

So glad this place exists. Every one who has ever taken or made my order has been super friendly and helpful. Coffee drinks and pastries are delicious, high quality and unique and the prices are on point! I come here most weekends to catch up on computery things or read and just enjoy the presence of people from all over our community.

great place!
This place has it all; great food, ambiance, staff. It's my new faorite lunch spot.

Excellent food, service, atmosphere, and one of the best waterfront views in all of Miami. What's not to love?
food is great, so is the service.
Enjoyed a nice lunch with a beautiful view after PAMM. The food was amazing but above all, the service provided by Lilliana was great!
I had eggs Benedict they were cold when they brought them to table.  I ordered what the waiter called bread basket for $8.00 it was 5 slices of bread.  Very disappointed

Had a great experience. From food to polite staff to the amazing view. It's a hidden quiet spot in midst of downtown. The outside setup is beautiful and peaceful with swinging hammock chairs, tall hanging plants, wooden steps and sand with an ocean view. Great for couple or families. Must experience!

Amazing views and very polite staff. Tomato panzanella was excellent; perfectly dressed and fresh and clean. The chicken sandwich was very tasty as was the broccoli rabe and sausage and pine nut pizza.
